figure_1: Carnobacterium inhibens isolated after incubation at 37 °C for 18 h. a, b 1–2 mm diameter, grey-colored, round, alpha-hemolytic colonies on 5% sheep blood agar. c Grey-colored, flat colonies surrounded by greenish discoloration around the colonies on chocolate agar. d Gram staining of blood culture isolate of C. inhibens depicting Gram-positive, asporogenous, lactobacillus-like rods, 100x
